https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/xunEeYZum4L1FAn12RDJdbkeesy.jpg When the slave ships docked in North America, Brazil, and the Caribbean, hundreds of cultures, traditions, and religions landed with the Africans on board, one transcended slavery beyond imagination and remains alive till this day in the New World: the Yoruba culture. Bigger Than Africa
